resources.string: Amorgos
Amorgos
Lost in the magical big blue
sans-serif-condensed
A photo of two large cubic volumes of green Tinian Marble leaning on each other at a quarry
Points of interest viewed
Overview
Highlights
TOPIC_NAME
Hiking in Amorgos
Beaches of Chora
Beaches of Katapola
Beaches of Aegiali
What to see in Chora
What to see in Katapola
What to see in Lagada
Beaches of Kato Meria

"This hiking trail used to be an ancient path, as the name itself says (old walk in Greek), for trading purposes. Most of its length coincides with the ancient road which connected Minoa with Aegiali. We also pay a visit to the iconic Monastery of Panagia Hozoviotissa - the second oldest monastery in Greece. This path helps you discover the wild beauty of Amorgian nature while you get informed about the island's cultural and historical heritage at the same time. It's the most popular long-distance route in Amorgos to hike and passes through the crest of a mountain at an altitude of around 400 meters."

The rocky and pebbled beach is just down from the Monastery of Hozoviotissa outside Chora. You can go there by car or walk about 30-40 minutes down from the monastery. Agia Anna has deep blue and crystal clear waters and is famous for the scenes in the movie “The Big Blue”.

The sandy beach is situated in the bay of Katapola from where you can reach it with the transfer boat or you can walk here in about 30 minutes. There is a beach bar with tables and benches to sit down in the shade and there are sunbeds and umbrellas for rent.

A long beautiful sandy beach in the middle of Aegiali bay. There is shade under the trees and shallow water suited for small children. Along the beach walk there are a play ground, taverns, bars and cafes and a few minutes walk to the village center where you will find supermarkets and other facilities.

Chora the capital of Amorgos is a medieval mountain village 400 meters above the sea surrounded by windmills. Chora is dominated by a 13th century Venetian castle, the historic rock has had built into it for more than fifteen centuries the church of Kera Leousa (Lady of mercy).

Katapola is the main port of Amorgos, this beautiful region is divided into three settlements called Katapola, Rachidi, and Xilokeratidi. Along the waterfront, it’s lined with cafes, taverns, and moorings for fishing boats and visiting sailing boats. In the middle of the bay, you have a small sandy beach, you can also walk or take the bath boat to some of the other nice beaches in the area.

Langada is located in the north part of Amorgos on the edge of the canyon of Araklos and surrounded by the highest mountains of the island, Krikellos is the highest with its 821 m. Langada is a genuine Greek village with narrow alleys, traditional whitewashed houses, and small churches. The traditional customs exist in everyday life and you will get the opportunity to take part in Greek daily life. There are also many beautiful walking paths that’s easy to access from the village.

Kalotaritissa beach is a fairly long beach located at the southern tip of the island and can be reached by car. It’s a charming little bay with sandy beach and a numerous of fishing boats are anchored here. There is one small beach cafe and sunbeds and umbrellas for rent.
